about: I am a software engineering student attending Iowa State University. Currently, I am a junior who has acheived 75/125 credit hours for the program, so I am quite a bit ahead. Even prior to my enrollment, I have years of experience programming, dating back to when I was only thirteen years of age. I developed an obsession with digital circuitry, and from that I attempted to construct microcontrollers, and from that I learned to code.
mission: I have strong individual and voluntary convictions to serve the overall benefit of my community and company, through industriousness, constitution, and personal accountability. In every group environment, I communicate with my peers the "who," "what," and "when" of each task, for the sake of expediting the workflow, as I reject the notion that efficiency and quality are somehow mutually exclusive. Rather; they are compounded in the higher productivity of labor, allowing the heightened profit of each individual.

questions.question: Would you be willing to relocate?
questions.answer: Yes, I would be able to relocate to practically anywhere.

questions.question: Are you able to also do physical hands-on work?
questions.answer: Yes, I am in excellent health and can easily find enjoyment in physical work.

questions.question: Would you be willing to do/make stuff that's awesome?
Are you able to run 7 miles in 41 minutes and 50 seconds?
